title: Pixel XL (1st gen) display failure
content:
The display for my 1st gen Pixel XL has failed. I've been given approval to swap it out under warranty but I need to get photos & video from it first (I was traveling in airplane mode when the failure occurred). Can anyone help me figure out how to get this data?
I think syncing the phone would be faster. The sensors still work-- it gives the vibrate response when I touch the screen-- but the LED is completely dark. If I can get through the startup with PIN and get it out of airplane mode, it would sync. But I can't see the buttons to get through this. Does this gen phone support USB cable connection to an external display?
If there's no way to get it to sync, is there a way to retrieve the photo/video data that is on the phone?
